title: Solana may outperform Ethereum in 2024; this meme coin could flip Shiba Inu - crypto.news
content:
Disclosure: This article does not represent investment advice. The content and materials featured on this page are for educational purposes only.

Crypto is bullish, and some experts speculate that Solana (SOL) may surpass Ethereum (ETH). Meanwhile, Galaxy Fox (GFOX), a meme coin on Ethereum, continues to gain momentum.

Galaxy Fox is proceeding to the sixth phase of its presale despite the Bitcoin (BTC) contraction, which also affected Shiba Inu (SHIB) prices.

GFOX dominance

Galaxy Fox combines GameFi with memecoin.

It aims to outperform other play-to-earn (P2E) tokens like ApeCoin (APE), Gala (GALA), The SandBox (SAND), and ICP.

You might also like: Polkadot holders shifting attention to GameFi Coins, including Galaxy Fox

In the ongoing presale, Galaxy Fox has sold over 2.1 billion GFOX.

Analysts expect GFOX to edge even higher in the months ahead due to its unique hybrid nature.

Features

Galaxy Fox supports staking.

GFOX holders can participate in NFT markets and play games.

Through staking, GFOX holders can receive a share of rewards from the Galaxy Fox Stargate.

Despite falling BTC prices, GFOX remains stable in the ongoing presale.

Why Galaxy Fox is unique

Galaxy Fox’s web3 runner game players can use GFOX to enhance their gaming attributes and gain an edge over competitors.

Holding GFOX also grants privileges to acquire Galaxy Fox NFTs.

You might also like: Polygon holders focusing on new memecoin project, Galaxy Fox

In addition to the gaming experience, players can convert GFOX into real money and purchase items in Galaxy Fox NFTs’ market and other community projects.

SOL takes on ETH

Solana has achieved a lot with meme coins and defi.

The project has partnered with traditional foreign banks and corporations like Shopify and Visa to improve their payment processes.

You might also like: Solana flips Ethereum in 7-day stablecoin volume

Solana offers more cost-effective options than Ethereum.

Moreover, SOL prices rose 530% from October to December. At one point, it was the fourth-largest crypto by market cap.

Take away

Crypto analysts are bullish on Galaxy Fox. It aims to be a play-to-earn sector leader, outperforming other meme coins. Ahead of GFOX listing, investors can explore the project’s potential.

title: Crypto Whales Accumulate Nearly $1,000,000,000 in ETH in Just One Month, According to Trader - The Daily Hodl
content:
A closely followed trader says that crypto whales are rapidly accumulating the leading smart contract platform Ethereum (ETH).

Analyst Ali Martinez tells his 39,700 followers on the social media platform X that deep-pocketed crypto traders have purchased 410,000 ETH, worth about $1 billion, in just the last month.

The trader shares a chart suggesting that the amount of Ethereum held in wallets with one million to 10 million ETH has been steadily rising since early December.

Ethereum is trading for $2,219 at time of writing, a fractional increase on the day.

Moving on to layer-2 scaling solution Polygon (MATIC), Martinez says that the Tom DeMark (TD) Sequential indicator, which aims to identify turning points in a market with a value of nine signaling a possible reversal, is flashing a bullish signal for the altcoin.

“Polygon: the TD Sequential presents a buy signal on MATIC four-hour chart. A spike in buying pressure around the current levels could see MATIC rebound, potentially toward $0.88, and even as high as $0.96.”

At time of writing, MATIC is worth $0.781.

Wrapping up his analysis with crypto king Bitcoin (BTC), Martinez says he remains bullish on the top digital asset as long it stays above its immediate support level.

“As long as Bitcoin maintains its position above $41,800, the outlook remains bullish. This crucial level is bolstered by 2.41 million addresses holding over one million BTC, forming a substantial support zone. Additionally, the resistance ahead appears relatively minor, further strengthening the potential for stable or rising prices.”

Bitcoin is trading for $44,069 at time of writing.

title: Ethereum Founder Vitalik Buterin Shares 4 Financial Tips - The Crypto Basic
content:
Ethereum’s co-founder Vitalik Buterin offers four financial tips to help new and seasoned investors mitigate risks amid massive volatility in the crypto space.

The Ethereum boss shared the tips after famous blogger Alexander Voigt highlighted how diversification strategy helped Microsoft founder Bill Gate to build his net worth.

How Microsoft Founder Boosts Portfolio Using Diversification Strategy

Voigt noted that when Gates became friends with prominent American businessman Warren Buffett, he sold most of his Microsoft shares. According to Voigt, the move helped Gates to diversify his portfolio and acquire other stocks.

- Advertisement -

As a result of the decision, the Microsoft founder built his fortune to $138 billion. Voigt emphasized that Gates would have been worth only $1.33 billion if he did not diversify his portfolio.

Ethereum Founder Reacts, Offers 4 Financial Tips

Reacting, Buterin characterized Voigt’s financial tip as awful. However, he offered four tips, which he described as “actual financial advice.”

This is awful advice. Some actual financial advice: * Diversification is good.

* Save. Get to the point where you have enough to cover multiple years of expenses. Financial safety is freedom.

* Be boring with most of your portfolio.

* Don't use >2x leverage. Just don't. https://t.co/CIvDJcD3UG — vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) January 7, 2024

The Ethereum founder first recognized the importance of diversification. Diversifying one’s portfolio cannot be overemphasized, as it helps mitigate risks. Spreading your investment across various assets would ensure that the negative performance of one asset does not entirely affect your portfolio.

Secondly, Buterin pointed out the importance of saving. He recommended that people should accumulate sufficient funds to the point where they can cover multiple years of expenses. It bears mentioning that there is no guarantee in investing, given the recent economic downturn that has wreaked havoc on most financial markets. Hence, saving more could help shield one from the problems associated with investing.

- Advertisement -

For the third point, Buterin encouraged investors to be boring with most of their portfolios. The concept of being boring with one’s portfolio suggests that people should opt for low-cost and low-risk assets. Here, Buterin recommends that people be prudent with investing instead of committing their funds to high-risk assets.

Lastly, the Ethereum founder warned against using high leverage when investing in the futures markets. Specifically, he cautioned against using over 2X leverage. This advice is necessary, especially in crypto trading, where volatility is rife. Recall that following a 7% dip in Bitcoin price last week, over $655 million worth of long positions were liquidated. The majority of long traders who got liquidated were mainly those who used high leverages.

Buterin’s financial tips are suitable for both new and seasoned crypto investors. They serve as a reminder, urging people to be prudent as they seek to bolster their portfolio.

title: Ethereum Price Eruption Past $3k Imminent? Investors Unpack Vitalik ‘s Bull Run Tips - CoinGape
content:
Ethereum, a leading cryptocurrency, has been on an upward trajectory for the past few months. The cryptocurrency value has soared from under $2,000 to $2,400, indicating a positive trend. However, the current market displays mixed sentiments about its future direction. The digital currency has been fluctuating within a defined range, showing signs of both strength and uncertainty.

As of the time of writing, Ethereum price value has impressively hit $2,270, marking a 0.78% increase in just 24 hours. This rise suggests a positive market mood. The trading volume, according to data by CoinMarketCap, has also seen an 84% jump in the same period, reaching $509 million. With a market capitalization of $10 billion, Ethereum ranks second among cryptocurrencies.

advertisement

Despite these gains, Ethereum faces a consolidation phase, especially under the $2,400 mark. The leading smart contracts token has been oscillating between $2,100 and $2,400 in the past week, with bears and bulls struggling. In the past year, Ether experienced a significant increase of over 79%, demonstrating resilience and optimism as bullish sentiment prevails despite occasional minor dips.

Vitalik Buterin’s Investment Tips for Ethereum Enthusiasts

Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of Ethereum, recently shared some investment wisdom. This came after a noted blogger, Alexander Voigt, discussed how diversification aided Bill Gates in wealth accumulation. Buterin, however, termed Voigt’s advice as subpar and offered his own financial guidelines.

This is awful advice. Some actual financial advice: * Diversification is good.

* Save. Get to the point where you have enough to cover multiple years of expenses. Financial safety is freedom.

* Be boring with most of your portfolio.

* Don't use >2x leverage. Just don't. https://t.co/CIvDJcD3UG — vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) January 7, 2024

Buterin’s tips are simple yet profound. He emphasizes the importance of diversification, suggesting that a varied portfolio can reduce risk. He advises investors to save enough to cover multiple years of expenses, stressing the value of financial safety and freedom. Buterin also recommends keeping the bulk of one’s portfolio in stable investments and strongly advises against using more than 2x leverage.

These guidelines are particularly relevant for both new and seasoned investors in the volatile cryptocurrency market. Adhering to such prudent strategies could potentially pave the way for Ethereum’s price to surge past the $3,000 mark. If the bullish trend persists, this milestone could soon be within reach.

Ethereum Technical Indicators Supporting a Bullish Outlook

Technical analysis of Ethereum’s price movement adds another layer of optimism. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is currently around the 50 mark, suggesting a balance in market momentum. On a 4-hour chart, Ethereum’s price has increased since breaking above the 200-day moving average and exiting a major descending channel. This bullish trend is visually evident through the formation of three four-hour green candlesticks.

Moreover, the Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) line has overtaken the signal line, indicating a positive market outlook. The rising histogram supports this bullish sentiment. The 20 Simple Moving Average (SMA) is on an upward curve, and the 50-day MA crossing over the 200-day MA reaffirms the bullish market sentiment. The Chaikin money flow indicator is also in the positive region at 0.04, indicating a bullish outlook.

Related Articles

title: Why Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Marathon Digital Jumped Today - The Motley Fool
content:
The SEC could approve the world's first spot Bitcoin ETF later this week.

Several major cryptocurrencies jumped on Monday as investors anticipate the first potential approval by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission of spot Bitcoin (BTC -0.30%) exchange-traded funds (ETFs) later this week. In particular, the SEC is widely expected to issue a favorable determination for Ark Invest's 21Shares Bitcoin ETF application before Wednesday.

The price of Bitcoin surged 6.7% by the end of the regular trading day, after briefly exceeding the $47,000 milestone for the first time since April 2022. Ethereum (ETH 0.01%) is also up more than 6%, while Marathon Digital (MARA -1.31%) -- a crypto mining firm whose fortunes tend to ebb and flow with the price of Bitcoin -- rose as much as 10.5% this morning before settling to close up 7.7%.

Crypto investors have marked their calendars for Jan. 10

The price of Bitcoin alone has nearly tripled over the past year. But its rally more recently gained steam back in October 2023 after the SEC declined to appeal a federal court's August reversal of an order that had prevented crypto-asset manager Grayscale Investments from converting its popular Grayscale Bitcoin Trust into an ETF. When the D.C. Circuit of Appeals subsequently formalized Grayscale's court win the following week, the onus moved back to the SEC to move forward with its approval processes for several other pending spot ETF applications from providers including BlackRock, Fidelity, and Ark Invest.

Fast-forward to today's rally -- and as I noted back in October -- the first of those deadlines happens to be this Wednesday, Jan. 10. That's specifically the date by which the SEC must approve or deny Ark Invest's open application for its "21Shares" Bitcoin ETF.

This is a big deal for the crypto market as a whole because ETFs would be a much more accessible medium for investors to put their money to work in cryptocurrency assets, at least compared to setting up a separate crypto account or wallet with a crypto-specific broker. ETF shares can also be bought and sold throughout the trading day through virtually any broker, similar to publicly traded stocks.

Expect several spot Bitcoin ETF approvals at once

Few expect Ark Invest's 21Shares to be the only spot Bitcoin ETF to receive approval this week, however.

The SEC could technically approve or deny each individual spot Bitcoin ETF application as their respective deadlines arrive in the coming months. But that would also effectively mean the earliest to receive approvals enjoy a so-called "first-mover" advantage, with the lion's share of investors' capital flowing into those early spot Bitcoin ETFs right away. That would be a massive windfall for those ETF providers, considering some estimates indicate the approval of Bitcoin ETFs could potentially increase the value of the overall crypto market by more than $1 trillion.

Instead, the SEC will almost certainly approve multiple applications in tandem with the Ark Invest 21Shares deadline this week. This scenario has been repeatedly supported by industry watchers observing several hopeful ETF providers simultaneously filing amended registration statements with the SEC over the past few months. Indeed, just last week crypto news site Cointelegraph reported that Ark 21Shares, VanEck Bitcoin Trust, Grayscale Bitcoin Trust, and Fidelity's spot Bitcoin ETF each filed new 8-A Forms with the SEC to register their shares as securities listed on multiple exchanges, indicating they're in the late stages of approval.

That said, investors shouldn't ignore the risk (however unlikely at this stage) that the SEC might deny those multiple spot Bitcoin ETF applications this week. The SEC previously rejected Ark's proposal almost exactly one year ago, for example, citing a lack of measures "to prevent fraudulent and manipulative acts." If the regulatory body offers any similar unexpected opposition this time, I would be shocked if assets like Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Marathon Digital didn't experience a sharp pullback as crypto investors took their recent profits off the table.
